message.content:
We only need to “pick” the entries that represent the initial capital contributions which are the three “Initial20231231001” records. In the input these three rows are:

 • Cash deposit with an amount of 3,000,000.0  
 • Bank deposit with an amount of 5,000,000.0  
 • Fixed Assets with an amount of 5,000,000.0  

Adding these up gives a total of 3,000,000 + 5,000,000 + 5,000,000 = 13,000,000.0

Because none of the following transactions (expenses, depreciation, sales, purchases, etc.) affect the paid‑in capital (these normally affect retained earnings or other profit‑related items), the ending balance for the paid‑in capital remains unchanged at 13,000,000.0.

Thus, we get:

Initial Paid‑in Capital: 13,000,000.00  
Final Paid‑in Capital: 13,000,000.00

Below is the answer in the required JSON format.

-------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "Paid-in Capital Initial Value": "13000000.00",
    "Paid-in Capital End Value": "13000000.00"
  }
}
